On 5/28/10 8:58 PM, prongs_wizzy wrote:
> Hi
> I want to extract sites from Internet Archive in an automatic manner
>
> Can I do that using Herititix..?
> I absolutely have no idea of how to go about with this stuff.

It's possible, but not really optimal -- both because the form of sites 
at the Internet Archive Wayback Machine has changed (with datestamps in 
the URLs) and the Heritrix settings/formats are optimized for archival 
rather than (what I'm guessing) your needs are.

You may want to look at 'Warrick' -- a web service (or downloadable 
tool) for reconstructing websites using not just the Internet Archive 
but other caches:

http://warrick.cs.odu.edu/

Or, other crawlers whose emphasis is on 'mirroring' a website to a 
directory tree, such as HTTrack:

http://www.httrack.com/

- Gordon @ IA
